com.defano.jmonet.canvas.surface

Interface ScalableLayeredPainting

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    PaintCanvas
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractPaintCanvas, JMonetCanvas

    public interface ScalableLayeredPainting
    An image with multiple layers that can be drawn at scale.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Point convertPointToImage(Point p)
      Converts a scaled, surface coordinate to a canvas coordinate and snaps the resulting coordinate to the nearest grid coordinate.
      BufferedImage[] getPaintLayers()
      Gets the layers of this image, in the order in which they should be drawn.
      double getScale()
      Gets the displayed scale factor of this image.

    • Method Detail

      • getPaintLayers

        BufferedImage[] getPaintLayers()
        Gets the layers of this image, in the order in which they should be drawn.
        Returns:
        The image layers

      • getScale

        double getScale()
        Gets the displayed scale factor of this image.
        Returns:
        The displayed scale factor of this image.

      • convertPointToImage

        Point convertPointToImage(Point p)
        Converts a scaled, surface coordinate to a canvas coordinate and snaps the resulting coordinate to the nearest grid coordinate. When no scale and no grid has been applied (i.e., scale = 1.0, grid = 1) then the output of this function is the same as its input. When a scale factor has been applied, then the input coordinates are divided by the scale factor. When a grid factor has been applied, the result of de-scaling the input is then rounded to nearest grid spacing factor.
        Parameters:
        p - A point in scaled, surface space
        Returns:
        The equivalent point in terms of the canvas image.
